Description: Fragment of wall of Attic red-figured pottery open vase; perhaps a krater, but thin-walled. Two objects part preserved: to left perhaps a basket, though with a wavy lower contour; to right, a larger white-painted object with added detail in dilute glaze, whose patterning does not resemble drapery.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1149)
